content: How can I remove a trailing newline character from a string in Python? For example, how can I convert the string "abc\n" to "abc"?

To remove a trailing newline character from a string in Python, you can use the `rstrip()` method. This method removes any trailing whitespace characters, including newline characters, from the end of the string. Here's how you can use it to convert the string `"abc\n"` to `"abc"`:

```python
original_string = "abc\n"
modified_string = original_string.rstrip("\n")
print(modified_string)
```

This will output:

```
abc
```

In this example, `rstrip("\n")` specifically removes the newline character from the end of the string. If you want to remove any kind of trailing whitespace, you can use `rstrip()` without any arguments.
